name: Idling to Rule the Gods
description: Idling to Rule the Gods is a free to play Idle-Game with a lot of content and some Minigames. Depending on your play-style, you can play it fast or slow. Either way it can be fun for hundreds of hours!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows Vista SP1 Processor: Intel Dual-Core 1.6GHz or faster processor Memory: 1 GB RAM Graphics: Graphic card with DX10 (Shader-Model 4.0) abilities DirectX: Version 10 Storage: 150 MB available space

reviews.review_text: the f*ck is this deviantart sh*t

This game has lots of depth and content and I have played this game for a long time back when it was on Kongregate and I loved it SOOO much, although it may not be a simple little clicker idle game where you click repeatedly, it is really well created props to the creator of this game I love it and will continue to love it for a while more.

the thing i hate about people discussing Idling games is that they usually say the one with the best graphics win. When i hear that i usually just get very dam mad. Because really there are better Idling games out there and this one is very unique. It comes with a story and it is actually a very dam good story. Unlike other Idle games that just focus on graphics this one does not. which is why i play it more then clicker heros or any other Idle game i have in my Library now

At first an interesting simple little idling game, until you start reading the story to it that comes in little sections after you defeat each god, then it becomes amazing. I'm really REALLY tempted to spend money just to get throught the story faster. Kudos to the creator for actually adding some real depth to an idle game.

TLDR : A great idling game to spend your youth and your focus (literally)  OK, so this is my first review of a game. And I choose this game. Why? Because I've played this game from early alpha, where you can only slap hyperion and barely have any hp left to win. I've seen my clones sitting there in the training tab, Whole 40k clones sitting on the training tab and wondering how much clones to Black-barring the skills. Ok enough for the rant, and here's my review.  You start with nothing. Except your name, gender, body, and your ability to create clone. The clones are what you get for doing nothing at the start of the game. And then you realize there's a training tab there. You clicked it and it shows you what can you do with your clone, let them train for you, the lazy one. Then, after a while, you realize that you can smack gods to create more things. Then after a few hours, you realize you just lost to some god. You get a rebirth, and starting your life again, just like reading from the start of this paragraph again. Only to realize you've lost hundreds of hours in this game.  And you realized, you are happy. Happy for a reason. Happy because you can smack more powerful gods.
Pretty good, mostly here for the story but the gameplay itself is fairly average if not slightly above average.
its pretty basic in terms of how it looks but it has a cool way of playing.

At the start, you will probably not enjoy the game that much because of it's complexibility, you will get confused at first glance and won't even have an idea of what you could possibly do but if you give this game a chance trying to understand it more deeply and do a small research about it in the internet, you will notice how this game is worth a try. This game easily differs from other idle games because of its innovative system, I started playing it yesterday because I was bored and despite all the doubts I had at the start, I can say it was pretty enjoyable. It's only a matter of time until you can learn or even master the game.  Some people judged the book by its cover while doing their bad reviews and didn't really try to play it, but like I already said, this game is very good, but it's not easy to get into. It's also important to say that this game is not pay2win, all the real money stuff you can buy are very optional and act like a gift for the ones who support the developers. Also, don't underestimate this game potential because of the simple graphics.
This idle game is simple and very addictive. I can see why most individuals find this type of game pointless but at the same time I enjoy idle games and this one is doing mostly everything right.

The game is free. It cost you nothing to try it out. But... (and this is where my positive review ends.  I can't defend spending money on this now unless you do it just to support the developers. There is only one thing I could concider getting, but not as long as the prizing is as it is. I honestly cant understand why they have made their purchases this expensive. This is a small marked, there is (or at least shouldn't be) any competetive reason to keep players at a blanced playing field, the game isn't interesting, and the game isn't that good. Why are you holding people back from experiencing your game? You have people who don't have my patience, that won't bother with this game, and you have people who have my patience that won't bother spending money on this. The only crowd I can concive that you are making money on is kids. This would just be abuse.  TL:DR The game is free to try, but I don't think they have anything to support their expensive ingame purchases. And it's hurting them selves in the prosess.

An oddly interesting game. Simple. Compelling. Options that aren't clear at first. I definately don't have an optimized game, but I enjoy it none-the-less. Currently stuck on the arty challenge. Looking forward to trying out pets and the daily draws when the challenge is over. Not for everyone, but I enjoy it.
Fun game takes time, paitence to understand. probably a fun game to try out. i dont think its gonna last long for me however.
they should add the ability to upload a god character from the desktop  9.5/10
432 hours are lost. I don't know what happened but I tried to play and I have to start from scratch again.

Great idle game with very in depth mechanics. The graphics may not be to all's liking but that is really the least important part of an idle game. The mechanics are detailed and unique enough to have a lot of fun with. Give it a chance even if you may not be drawn in by the art style.
I have played a lot of clickers and have to say this is pretty damn dull. I\'m amazed it has such great ratings.
A free steam game with you being able to beat gods?Yea.

THIS GAME IS FREAKING AMAZING! I no lifed this game when it was nothing but a flash game, and i plan to do the same here. If you like idle games, check it out. Its a bit slow in the beggining, but trust me. you WANT to play more.

This game was my life. I used to play this game all the time when it was on Kongregate. This is definitely the sort of game where you need to be patient to be able to do anything at all, but if you put the time into it, new things will unlock, and you will be able to create matter, build monuments, trade things and even convert those matter into planets and the such. And now I can see that there are new features added into the mix; I am really looking forward to playing with that. Overall,Idling to Rule the Gods is definitely something you should leave in the background whilst you do other things, and come back to see how the avatar 'you' did whilst you were elsewhere. I definitely recommend a try at the very least, maybe you can grow to like the charms of this strange little idle game.  EDIT: And now I found out that there are lores, detailed lores that outlines how you've came to be, why you are fighting creatures and gods, as well as how your powers came to be, and how they relates to gods. This is amazing and it tied the different pieces of game mechanics together. I have never expected such a detailed lore for this game, and now I am more glad than ever to have found this game again years after the last time I played it.
Thank gods and godesses that Steam is blocked at my workplace! This game is a serious productivity killer.

Uh first review so uh.. Its a free game. thats a plus... Its an Idle game that goes with your pace... Thats a plus if you like idle games.... Uh.. Its reaaally in depth and simple.. So I guess thats a double plus....
Best idle game out there.
I've played (probably too many) idle games, but if I had to pick one I'd pick this one. Its depth and story take the cake for me.

Where so many idlers focus on the fancy art and click effects that you get bored of after the first twenty minutes, ITRTG is all about questing for the next increment. The game is ugly; there's no denying that, but the underlying mechanics are polished and there's actually a dozen different things to split your non-time on. For the first couple of weeks of game play, I'd think I was done unlocking new goals only to discover yet another additional mechanic to level up. Then I looked closer at the Challenges and realized there's a load of reasons to reset from zero for even MORE permanent bonuses. I've been poking at this thing for most of a year and I haven't even built a galaxy yet.  If you're looking for a time-eating incremental idler, this is a good one. There are tons of different goals to work towards at your own pace and an honestly interesting back story told through an optional side menu.
Great game.  I really enjoy game, Yeath I could like to see some good graphics. Idea of this game is so great.
